laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal to low in patients; hypokalemia is noted in some cases.

Increased ratio of urinary free cortisol to cortisone; (THF/THF)/THE ratios showed an abnormal range, with values being 2.4 to 40, and notably low urinary free cortisone in nearly all cases except one.
Patients presented with high blood pressure (bp) ranging from 140/100 to 200/100 mmHg depending on the case.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Two years later, BP was normalized in one case following treatment.
